answers.answer: Hi,How are you? What other symptoms are present? Rest and pain medications may help provide relief. However, if pain persists, further evaluation may need to be done by your attending physician. Additional diagnostic tests such as imaging studies may also be done to help determine the underlying cause. Regular monitoring of blood sugar and intake of maintenance medications for diabetes are highly  recommended. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: I have diabetic neuropathy left food is almost completely numb.  Six months ago I had a series of very painful falls.  One time I ended up with concussion, etc.   A couple of times the fall was especially painful but the bruises didn't show up right away.  On fall in particular left a very painful right thigh...the bruise didn't surface until two weeks later.  It was a massive bruise- showing as a very deep blue and purple.  It took 3-4 weeks for it to go away. Now, 6 months later, that same area is extremely painful and seems to be getting worse.  What should I do at this point?  I have been trying to ignore it, but it's just becoming too painful,
title: lastng pain after fall
